posts.author: scoobytoobins
posts.post_text: April 1, 2020 at 2:09 PM#5best way to do this would be to assign it first with a variable.if you want to select it manually use:setvar $yourvar = @assign $yourvar /dir /groups etc.if you want to pick using user input use:setvar $yourvar = (which effect number?)assign effect $yourvar /dir /groups etc.if you want to use it in a cmd with effect lines specified (1.effect.line) then i'd recommend doing it the user input way so you avoid the word 'effect' in your variable.i.e. you can't assign 1.effect 419.2 but you can assign effect 1.$yourvar.2

posts.post_text: April 22, 2020 at 12:20 AM#10hisome time ago i also thought about  to adress the effects without having to open the effect window.the intention was to control 6 attributes for 6 groups, stored in 6 sequences assigned to 6 fadersfor all controls i filled 360 macros with multiple lines.i used the comparator for lots of lines. for the form selector i ended up with this:the var $gen5 contains 6 effect pool items$gen5=effect 580 th 585-form selector-SetVar $gen5form ("1 sin, 2 pwm, 3 maxnet, 4 bass, 5 circle")[$gen5form==1]  Assign Form 8 $gen5[$gen5form==2]  Assign Form 4 $gen5[$gen5form==3]  Assign Form 101 $gen5[$gen5form==4]  Assign Form 20.2 $gen5[$gen5form==5]  Assign Form 19 $gen5for value changes im able to just enter + or - , or numberssome variables must be created first, before starting the macrothis example sets the /with=     for one effect-value changer-SetVar $gen51wthval=(" + or - or number ")[$gen51wthval==+]  AddVar $gen51wth=+5[$gen51wthval==-]  AddVar $gen51wth=-5[$gen51wthval>=0]  SetVar $gen51wth=$gen51wthval[$gen51wth>100]  SetVar $gen51wth=100[$gen51wth<0]  SetVar $gen51wth=0Assign Effect 1.580 /width=$gen51wthand many more...thats one control page of 6:https://www.magentacloud.de/lnk/pniMBI3R[Blocked Image:https://www.magentacloud.de/lnk/pniMBI3R]link seems not to work, open it in separate tab

posts.author: Jbmckenzie
posts.post_text: May 9, 2020 at 10:09 PM#11Here is a macro that allows you to select an effect, and then edit an attribute within it such as groups, wings, etc.SetVar $Effect = (Which effect do you want to edit?)SetVar $Change = (What attribute?)SetVar $Amount = (How many?)Assign Effect $Effect /$Change=$AmountThere might be a more efficient way to do this but it works...
